adjective.description: Involving or characterized by sudden leaps, jerks, or starts. Also as noun: something characterized by sudden leaping or jerking.

origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in William Rawley (c1588–1667), Church of England clergyman and literary editor. From post-classical Latin subsultorius fitful from classical Latin subsult-, past participial stem of subsilīre to jump up, spring up + -ōrius.
